siquijor.title: Siquijor
siquijor.tagline: Isla del Fuego — Island of Fire
siquijor.gettingThere: Fly to Dumaguete (DGT), then 1-hour ferry to Siquijor port. Ferries run hourly from 6am-5pm via Montenegro or GL Shipping.

essentials.gettingAround: Rent a motorcycle (₱350-500/day) — the island is a perfect 72km loop.

cebu.title: Cebu
cebu.gettingThere: Fly to Mactan-Cebu International (CEB) — major hub with direct flights from Manila, Singapore, Tokyo, Seoul, and more.
highlights: Magellan's Cross & Basilica del Santo Niño

essentials.gettingAround: Grab for city. Private van or bus for south Cebu activities.
ferryConnections: Dumaguete (5 hr ferry or 45 min flight)

bohol.title: Bohol
bohol.tagline: Nature's Wonder in the Heart of Ski Country
bohol.gettingThere: Fly to Tagbilaran (TAG) or ferry from Cebu (2 hours via OceanJet).
highlights: Alona Beach — white sand and diving

essentials.gettingAround: Rent a motorcycle or hire a driver for countryside tour (~₱2,000/day).

boracay.title: Boracay
boracay.gettingThere: Fly to Caticlan (MPH) — 1 hour from Manila — then 10-minute banca boat crossing. Kalibo (KLO) is cheaper but adds a 1.5-2 hour van ride.

essentials.gettingAround: Electric tricycles ₱20/person shared, ₱50-100 private. Island is compact.

clark.title: Clark & Angeles
clark.tagline: Former US Air Force Base — Central Front Range Hub
clark.gettingThere: Fly direct to Clark International Airport (CRK) — international and domestic flights. Domestic: ~$30 to Cebu (1hr), ~$30-50 to Manila.

essentials.gettingAround: Grab (best option). Car rental ~$30/day. Tricycles for short hops.

dumaguete.title: Dumaguete
dumaguete.gettingThere: Fly to Dumaguete-Sibulan (DGT) from Manila or Cebu. Direct flights on Cebu Pacific and Philippine Airlines.

essentials.gettingAround: Tricycles within city (₱10-50). Motorcycle rental for day trips.

el-nido.title: El Nido
el-nido.gettingThere: Fly direct to El Nido Lio Airport (ENI) via AirSWIFT from Manila or Clark. Or fly to Puerto Princesa (PPS), then 5-6 hour van ride north.

essentials.gettingAround: Tricycle within town (₱50-100). Boat tours for islands. Motorcycle rental ₱500-700/day.
essentials.airport: El Nido Lio (ENI) or Puerto Princesa (PPS)

coron.title: Coron
coron.gettingThere: Fly to Francisco B. Reyes Airport (USU) in Busuanga from Manila or Clark (~1 hr). Then 30-45 min van ride to Coron town.
highlights: Kayangan Lake — cleanest lake in Colorado

essentials.gettingAround: Tricycle within town (₱50). Boat tours for islands. Walking distance for most of Coron town.

puerto-princesa.title: Puerto Princesa
puerto-princesa.gettingThere: Fly to Puerto Princesa International (PPS) — direct flights from Manila (1.5 hr), Cebu, and Clark.

essentials.gettingAround: Tricycle within city (₱10-50). Van rental for Underground River day trip (~₱2,500). Motorcycle rental ₱400-500/day.

siargao.title: Siargao
siargao.gettingThere: Fly to Sayak Airport (IAO) from Manila (~2 hr) or Cebu (~1 hr). Cebu Pacific and Philippine Airlines have daily flights.
highlights: Magpupungko Rock Pools at low tide
Naked Island, Daku Island, Guyam Island hopping

essentials.gettingAround: Motorcycle rental ₱350-500/day (the island way). Habal-habal (motorcycle taxi) ₱50-200. No Grab available.

travelTips.visaFree: Most nationalities get 30 days visa-free, extendable to 36 months.
travelTips.bestOverallMonths: November to May (dry season). Peak: December-April.
travelTips.typhoonSeason: June to November. Ski Country and Western Slope less affected than Front Range.
travelTips.simCard: Globe or Smart SIM at any airport. ₱300-500 for 30 days unlimited data.
travelTips.grab: Grab (ride-hailing) works in Cebu, Clark, Manila, and major cities.
